Dr. Goodwin,

Do you have an estimate as to when you'll post the updated Vi=
sual 
Studio project files for version 1.7.1?  I've tried generating an msi=
 
file and received multiple errors that I believe are associated with 
the=
 new directory structure.

Thanks.
Rusty

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, D=
avid Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> This message is for those of you who=
 are compiling Cantera from  
> source code from CVS...
> 
> I am about to =
make some significant changes to the directory  
> structure in the Cantera=
 source tree, specifically in directory  
> Cantera/src.  This is necessary=
 to clean up some dependency issues  
> between different Cantera libraries=
, and will result in a layout 
that  
> is much easier to understand.
> 
> =
I have tagged the current version of the repository with the tag  
> "Relea=
se_1_7_0_final".  You can continue to check out the code 
with  
> the curr=
ent directory structure using this tag.
> 
> Later today I will begin movin=
g files in the repository. The  
> reorganized version will be 1.7.1.  If y=
ou are building Cantera 
with  
> Visual Studio under Windows, hold off on =
updating from CVS until I  
> have a chance to recreate the Visual Studio p=
roject files.
> 
> Soon after this reorganization is complete, some additio=
nal  
> capabilities will be added, including the ability to access new  
>=
 equations of state from Python or MATLAB (e.g. liquid 
electrolytes),  
> =
and a much improved ability to specify time-dependent attributes 
in  
> re=
actor networks.
>
